title: Children's learning game (letters, numbers, colors) with progress tracking

requirements.text: Create a kid-friendly home screen for a new children's learning game that lets the player choose a learning category (at minimum: Letters, Numbers, Colors) and start a game session.

quotes: I want new game learning for child

acceptanceCriteria: Home screen is the default view on load
Player can select one of the available categories (Letters, Numbers, Colors)
A clear 'Start' action begins the game session for the selected category
All user-facing text is in English

requirements.text: Implement the core learning game loop: show one question at a time with 3–4 large multiple-choice answers, provide immediate feedback (correct/incorrect), and advance through a short round (e.g., 10 questions) with an end-of-round summary.

quotes: I want new game learning for child

acceptanceCriteria: Each question screen shows exactly one prompt and 3–4 selectable answers
Selecting an answer shows immediate feedback and then advances to the next question
A round contains a fixed number of questions (minimum 10)
End-of-round screen shows total correct answers and a simple reward indicator (e.g., stars earned)
UI elements are large and easy to tap/click

requirements.text: Provide a built-in question bank for the minimum categories (Letters, Numbers, Colors) with age-appropriate prompts and answers, and ensure the game can randomly select questions without repeats within a round when possible.

quotes: I want new game learning for child

acceptanceCriteria: Question bank exists for Letters, Numbers, and Colors with enough questions to support at least one 10-question round per category
Questions are randomly selected for each round
The same question is not repeated within the same round unless the category has fewer available questions than the round length

requirements.text: Add progress tracking so a player’s best score and total rounds played are saved per category and can be displayed on the home screen (or a simple 'Progress' view). Persist progress on the backend keyed by the user principal when available.

quotes: I want new game learning for child

acceptanceCriteria: After completing a round, the app updates progress for the selected category (best score, rounds played)
Progress persists across page reloads for the same signed-in principal
Home (or Progress view) displays best score and rounds played per category
If the user is not signed in, the app still functions (progress display may be hidden or treated as temporary)

requirements.text: Apply a cohesive, playful visual theme appropriate for young children (warm, bright palette; rounded shapes; large typography; clear spacing) and enforce it consistently across all screens without using a blue/purple primary palette.

quotes: I want new game learning for child

acceptanceCriteria: All screens share a consistent theme (colors, typography, components) suitable for children
Primary UI components (buttons/cards) use rounded corners and high-contrast text
No blue/purple primary palette is used for the main theme

requirements.text: Add required generated static images (mascot, background, category icons) to the frontend and render them from the static assets directory (frontend/public/assets/generated) in the UI.

quotes: I want new game learning for child

acceptanceCriteria: Generated images are stored under frontend/public/assets/generated
Home screen shows the mascot and background image
Each category (Letters, Numbers, Colors) displays its icon in the UI

constraints: Backend must remain a single Motoko actor (all logic in backend/main.mo).
Do not modify files under frontend/src/components/ui (compose them instead).

Do not modify immutable paths: frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.ts, frontend/src/hooks/useInternetIdentity.tsx, frontend/src/hooks/useActor.ts, frontend/src/main.tsx, frontend/src/components/ui.
Use English for any user-facing text.
nonGoals: External APIs for text-to-speech, speech recognition, or content generation.

required: Friendly cartoon mascot (smiling bear) on transparent background (mascot-bear.dim_512x512.png)
Soft playful background with warm pastel shapes (no text) (bg-playroom.dim_1920x1080.png)
Flat rounded icon for Letters category (icon-letters.dim_256x256.png)
Flat rounded icon for Numbers category (icon-numbers.dim_256x256.png)
Flat rounded icon for Colors category (icon-colors.dim_256x256.png)

goalsToAdd: Build a new children's learning game application.
